edge_1: Parker tells him that he is no longer a part of Facebook and has security eject him from the building after Saverin's name had already been removed from the masthead as co-founder and CFO, and Saverin vows to sue Zuckerberg.
edge_2: Saverin becomes enraged when he discovers that the new investment deal allows his share of Facebook to be diluted from 34% to 0.03%, without diluting the ownership percentage of any other owner. He confronts Zuckerberg and Parker, and Saverin vows to sue Zuckerberg. Later, in separate depositions, Saverin claims his shares of Facebook were unfairly diluted when the company was incorporated.
edge_3: Alone, Zuckerberg sends a Facebook friend request to Albright and repeatedly refreshes the page.
